abstract: C.E.S. doesn’t want to be overshadowed by Apple. So executives here point out that Apple is part of the club.
snippet: C.E.S. doesn’t want to be overshadowed by Apple. So executives here point out that Apple is part of the club.
lead_paragraph: Quantity-wise, C.E.S. has nothing to apologize for. At last count, it has something just shy of a gazillion gadgets and companies.

headline.main: But You Know, Apple Is Really Just One of Us

abstract: This year, sales will be greater for speaker systems and clock radios designed to hook up to Apple iPods than standalone desktop stereos and home theater-in-a-box systems.
snippet: This year, sales will be greater for speaker systems and clock radios designed to hook up to Apple iPods than standalone desktop stereos and home theater-in-a-box systems.
lead_paragraph: Matt Richtel compared being at the Consumer Electronics Show to a return to the tripped out days of the 1960s. My experience, the several times I ventured onto the convention floor in Las Vegas, was somewhat less pleasant: It felt like I was a ball trapped inside a pachinko machine in Tokyo’s Ginza district.
